term.title: voltammetric constant

item.text: In linear-sweep voltammetry and related techniques, the empirical quantity defined by the equation ip/A.sqrt(ν).cB (= jp/sqrt(ν).cB) is the peak current, A is the area of the electrode-solution interface, ν is the rate of change of applied potential, and cB is the bulk concentration of the substance B whose reduction or oxidation is responsible for the peak in question.

sources.item: PAC, 1985, 57, 1491. 'Recommended terms, symbols, and definitions for electroanalytical chemistry (Recommendations 1985)' on page 1505 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198557101491)
